website_summaries.verdict: A lightweight, yet tough compression bag that can hold a lot of gear without ripping or wearing out.
pros: 3 quick-release compression straps give you easy access to belongings
Seams are tough and won't break open
cons: Some users have said that the bag is smaller than they were expecting

customer_reviews.title: NOT Water Resistant, Soaks through immediately.
customer_reviews.text: Not water resistant at all. Tested with a towel in the shower and soaked through instantly and thoroughly despite the misleading product photo that shows water beading on the fabric. Fit and compressed my 15 degree down pretty good to about 9-10" in length. Main buckle can't hold the same tension as the stationary buckles, so max compression wasn't an option.
customer_reviews.author: Kephart

customer_reviews.title: 2L~6L does that mean 4L ?
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my dogs sleeping bag...NOT even gonna fit. Managed to get a very small camp pillow into it, but it took some work. Very disappointed. It ACTUALLY measures 6'x 10", not the 14" advertised or it would have worked fine. I wanted a 5L bag figuring it would be 1/2 the size of all the 10L bags I own. A 10L would be overkill for my dogs sleeping bag and I want her to be able to carry her own camping gear on her pack not mine ! Built well enough, though the size is closer to 3 or 4L. Back to looking elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Danni Britton

customer_reviews.title: So far holding up well. Great value.
customer_reviews.text: I needed compression sack for my average sized, 3-season down sleeping bag. The top bag is the original and the bottom is the Aegismax. Those saved inches mean a lot backpacking. So far it seems to be working out really well. I do not see any signs of weakness and so far the stuff sack is holding up.
customer_reviews.author: JerseyMike

customer_reviews.title: Exceptional.
customer_reviews.text: At first, I thought this sack looked super flimsy. How is something this thin going to hold up to me packing in my sleeping bag I thought? Let alone compressed it to a reasonable degree? But then I squeezed/compressed my sleeping bag into the sack and found the sack to be surprisingly sturdy. No seams came undone. I then used this sack for an intense 4 day camping trip and the sack held up without any problem, even with several unpacking/repacking/compressing. I am very impressed about the build and quality. And the price is right. I think this will last for quite awhile more.
customer_reviews.author: J. C.

customer_reviews.title: Trail tested
customer_reviews.text: I’m not the gentle push in type, I lean more to the angry-looking stuff/punch in side. (I’m not angry, I just don’t like to waste time fighting with my gear so I stuff aggressively.) I can testify for the durability of this brand because after being so impressed with the previous sack (which has 40+ uses and still looks and performs as new) I bought another for my underquilt.
customer_reviews.author: Tiwohunter

customer_reviews.title: Great compression and seems waterproof
customer_reviews.text: My sleeping bag is 7.3 liters. I bought a 6 liter sack. It's tough to make it fit, but I manage to do it and this bag holds up really well. The straps seem sturdy, and hold up despite being stuffed over-capacity. I don't need waterproofing, but I tested it in my shower and it seemed to handle splashes of water just fine in my brief testing. I wouldn't toss it into a lake, but moderate rain will probably be fine. The materials are pretty lightweight so it doesn't affect my overall pack weight much and makes my sleeping bag take up less than half the space it did with my bag's included stuff sack.
customer_reviews.author: D. Herbert

customer_reviews.title: Great value in a compression sack
customer_reviews.text: Overall I really like this stuff sack! In testing I was able to get a packable blanket down into a much smaller size than I expected. Stitching seems good and the sack works just fine. The only minor things I'd change is that I'd like to see four straps instead of three to get a bit more compression with less strain on the straps, but to be honest it seems to be holding up fine. And I wish there were more colors than just the green. Still, I'll be ordering a few more I expect. Well worth the money.
customer_reviews.author: Robert C. Babcock

customer_reviews.title: Wow!
customer_reviews.text: Ok, when I opened it up I thought "What in the hell". I have an old ozark trail (walmart) sleeping bag that I turned into a underquilt for my hammock. That's what I bought this compression sack for. I really thought that there was no way it would work and compress it down enough for me to even think about taking on my winter camping trip. Well this sack compressed it down to half of what was the smallest I could pack it. Not sure about longevity but it certainly impressed me. Will buy again..... Great job on the manufacturer.
customer_reviews.author: @joejoe8888

customer_reviews.title: Garbage, seams breaking.
customer_reviews.text: I have a jacket, 3 pairs of socks, a beanie cap, snow gloves, light backpacking pants and shirt, basketball shorts, and two pairs of boxer briefs, and the seam on the top is breaking. 2 days before my backpacking trip. I am furious. Buy elsewhere ladies and gents, this is a terrible product.
customer_reviews.author: B. Berry

customer_reviews.title: great bag for the price.  wish it had 4 straps instead of 3
customer_reviews.text: excellent bag. we use these for our 20degree REI igneo bags. the bags fit easily in the medium size and we can also fix a medium thermarest pillow when we wanted to keep those together. only grip is that it has 3 straps on the sides instead of 4 so that ends up making the bag compress funny. our 4 strap bags compress more evenly but then they were twice as expensive too. we've used these on 4 backpacking trips and would highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: mary

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic Product
customer_reviews.text: These are GREAT. I bought one for my rain gear to try and ensure the size was correct. It was so good that I bought 2 more for packing clothing. I used these for a back country hunting trip; organization was much easier and pack was more compact. The small size fit socks, underwear, and t-shirts for 5 days. Construction is quality, straps are quality, light weight... great! Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Brian

customer_reviews.title: Not great
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my sleeping bag, but unfortunately it was too small, that's my fault. I decided to use it as my clothes bag instead. It's very lightweight, which is good, but I don't feel like it's very durable. I'm scared to tighten the straps all the way because they seem flimsy, I'm also worried about the stitching and the clips as they don't seem that strong or durable. I will not be purchasing again or recommending this bag to others.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew T McDermott

customer_reviews.title: Less expensive but quality
customer_reviews.text: I took this on a two week hiking/camping trip and it worked just as well as the more expensive ones I own. I purchased the small size for socks, bras, underwear and gloves. You can since it down very tightly with no ripping or tearing of the sack. And the quick release clip on one strap was very handy!
customer_reviews.author: Slick_Nic

customer_reviews.title: Great compression stuff sack
customer_reviews.text: Cheap, and perfect for what I needed it for. I use it to pack stuff on my bike when I'm going motorcycle camping to keep the pack size down. Works great and inexpensive. May buy some more.
customer_reviews.author: DB

customer_reviews.title: Well Made & Worked
customer_reviews.text: Don't know how waterproof or durable it was, but it worked very well as what it was supposed to do - be a compression stuff sack. Seemed well made and very light weight. 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: John H

customer_reviews.title: Perfect.
customer_reviews.text: Not sure about the water resistance as these are not dry bags but just compression sacks. Extremely lightweight and surprisingly durable. Would recommend. The XS fits my military poncho liner perfectly and the S fits my down quilts perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Codey Mac

customer_reviews.title: Mine came with a sleeping bag!
customer_reviews.text: Ultralight. Quality is ok, I bought this for a jacket, came with a sleeping bag. Who knew?
customer_reviews.author: American Patriot

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and looks
customer_reviews.text: I bought this to lighten the load on a trekking pole tent I recently purchased that came with an overly large compression bag. It worked great and nearly halfed it's pack weight. I was very surprised at the quality of this bag for its price. Very light and well made. Definitely would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Chris and Lauryn

customer_reviews.title: Great space saver.
customer_reviews.text: Worked great. Needed to bring a down jacket on my 2+ week trip to warm, humid trip to Cambodia. Why did I need a down jacket? Had a full day layover in Shanghai in mid-December. Stuffed the jacket in the bag, compressed, and attached the bag to my carry-on using a small carabiner.
customer_reviews.author: Dan L.

customer_reviews.title: Really small, thin material
customer_reviews.text: The compression sack does run very small. Two sizes from the description might be adequate. Plus, very thin material. I would not recommend.
customer_reviews.author: bobcat931

customer_reviews.title: Better than I thought it would be
customer_reviews.text: Better than I thought it would be for compressing a 10 degree sleeping bag to fit in the bottom of my ultralight backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Hap

customer_reviews.title: Great lightweight compression sack
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought the XS size (2 - 6L) for my pillow, but it's actually a little bigger than the compression sack that comes with the AEGISMAX sleeping bag. So now I use it for my bag. I'm very happy with the purchase, and plan to buy a larger size for another sleeping bag I have.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan

customer_reviews.title: Jealous
customer_reviews.text: I gave this to my beautiful wife for backpacking. I ordered a different one from ALPS. Her AegisMax is better. Much better. This sack is worth the money. Happy Trails. Look out for snakes.
customer_reviews.author: DN

customer_reviews.title: works good for light weight sleeping bags and camping blankets.
customer_reviews.text: I use these for some camping blankets I have and they work well. You could put what you want in them that can be compressed to make them smaller and easier to carry.
customer_reviews.author: M

customer_reviews.title: it's a bag
customer_reviews.text: how do you review a bag? It's very lightweight. Straps were a bit confusing at first. Make sure to buy the right size and pack it FULL. It squishes down funny if it's not full. Overall it works.
customer_reviews.author: mikemech

customer_reviews.title: Great general purpose stuff sack
customer_reviews.text: Great general purpose stuff sack. I got the 3.3L~10L (which I interpret to mean that it can compress 10L down to 3.3L). It's the perfect size for a woobie, and stuffs it much smaller than I thought a woobie could be stuffed. It feels a little bit weak/flimsy in the cinch buckles but time will tell if they hold up or not
customer_reviews.author: C. Johnson

customer_reviews.title: A great bag for down.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing compression, decently durable. This product is for high fill- power goose down sleeping bags, don't get this product for your synthetic or cheapo sleeping bag. A lot of the one star reviews suffer from that mistake.
customer_reviews.author: Adam P. Michelson

customer_reviews.title: Budget Oriented Compression Sack
customer_reviews.text: I didn't have high hopes for this bag but it turned out to be amazing. I use this with my Sierra Designs Backcountry Bed. It fits perfectly and works great. Very light but still strong. Packs down very small. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Kevan Ray

customer_reviews.title: I LOVE THESE!
customer_reviews.text: I LOVE THESE!! Super lightweight. Extremely flexible. Go a size up if you're not sure. You want everything to fit in there comfortably when open, THEN sinch it down.
customer_reviews.author: Kristin

customer_reviews.title: Success!
customer_reviews.text: Took a learning curve to figure out how to make my sleeping bag fit in the compression sack and then into the internal pack but I DID IT! Great color and the straps are durable as expected.
customer_reviews.author: Janelle H

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Worked well for travelling, helped keep my stuff as compact as possible.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good function and size option,water resistant only
customer_reviews.text: This is water resistant, but has good compression. I bought the 14L and it works great for the magma 17 bag. I put it and me dry clothes in a dry sack to add an additional layer of protection to prevent any moisture from getting into my down bag.
customer_reviews.author: Madison Adams

customer_reviews.title: Ok... but not a replacement for a heavier duty sack
customer_reviews.text: super lightweight but seems to hold what I wanted it to hold. If you are thinking this will be the same quality as a Sea to Sea Compression bag but maybe just a better deal, think again though. I am a little bit worried about it coming apart but only time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Tabitha W

customer_reviews.title: Great compression sack
customer_reviews.text: I love these compression sacks. I have a small one and an extra large one. The materials seem cheap but I have abused these sacks pretty good and haven’t had any issues. Plus I really appreciate the fact that I can order these in different sizes.
customer_reviews.author: Randy Turrentine

customer_reviews.title: Light, inexpensive, fits a lot, snap buckle could fail
customer_reviews.text: Seems great so far. I fit a 2 person backpackers tent and fly in it, minus poles obviously. Only thing I'm worried about is the plastic snap buckle. It's convenient for getting the straps out of the way when putting things in the bag, but if it ever breaks, the bag is completely useless. Seems like a weak point that didn't have to be added.
customer_reviews.author: Alan S.

customer_reviews.title: Good quality lightweight and seem sturdy so far
customer_reviews.text: Used these on a very wet hike on the AT. Was able to pack down gear significantly and it prevented damp getting in and damp getting out when packing away rain flys etc. Good quality lightweight and seem sturdy so far! Would definitely buy more if needed. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: DM

customer_reviews.title: thin material (worry about tearing) keeps me from really compressing as much as I'd like.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: Light weight, lotta room Cons: Seems a little flimsy: thin material (worry about tearing) keeps me from really compressing as much as I'd like.
customer_reviews.author: Gabe

customer_reviews.title: Didn't fit
customer_reviews.text: this was not the right size for my sleeping bag. It was slightly too small and didn't fit properly.. Maybe I didn't properly size it but from my understanding the size was 2 sizes too low
customer_reviews.author: Frank Hu

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size for my army issue poncho liner
customer_reviews.text: I use this stuff sack for my standard issue poncho liner and it works great! Stitching is solid throughout and the plastic clip holds solid under a lot of pull.
customer_reviews.author: Austintm

customer_reviews.title: This compression sack has worked great. It was perfect for my new sleeping bag ...
customer_reviews.text: This compression sack has worked great. It was perfect for my new sleeping bag that has a small compression size. I like that it has a quick release strap so I can easily get the contents out of the sack. It seems overall durable and like it will hold up to my endless use.
customer_reviews.author: Dr SpaceMan

customer_reviews.title: Pretty darned durable
customer_reviews.text: Pretty darned durable. I cranked down on mine pretty hard and not a bit of issue. I've been using them for about two months and so far so good. If you're anxious about long-term usage, go for the premier brands if you wish, but for the price, these are great.
customer_reviews.author: SGDuval

customer_reviews.title: good value
customer_reviews.text: Nice compression sack for the price. You can't really compress it too tightly as the tighteners don't hold that well but the 14L works great for my backpacking sleeping bag. I will be ordering a 30L for clothes.
customer_reviews.author: sonox

customer_reviews.title: Best choice
customer_reviews.text: Great to make space in your pack shouldn't hick without competition bags.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: works great. i love compression sacks and this one is affordable and well-made.
customer_reviews.author: Wesley D. Huffmaster

customer_reviews.title: You get less than you pay for
customer_reviews.text: You cant compress much with this. It's very thin and only single stitched. I wouldn't recommend for any serious use.
customer_reviews.author: Brandon Corbett

customer_reviews.title: Good product
customer_reviews.text: I've bought it for Mountain Equipment Glacier 450 which weight 1KG. The 14L is too big and I guess the 10L will fit better. Rather than that, this is well made item. It's light and well constructed.
customer_reviews.author: L

customer_reviews.title: Three straps
customer_reviews.text: This compression bag has only 3 straps. It still works but has a tendency to pooch out one side. Great for the money though....
customer_reviews.author: Len K.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality and very lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and very lightweight compared to more expensive brands. This is the only brand I'll be buying
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Love it. I have a kelty sac in addition ...
customer_reviews.text: Love it. I have a kelty sac in addition to this one. I alternat between them with no preference. The material seems week, but I have not had problems of any sort. I fit my kelty mummy bag in a medium size
customer_reviews.author: daniel

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Poor quality materials. Got a hole in it the first time I used it.
customer_reviews.author: k gannon

customer_reviews.title: A useful backpack accessory!
customer_reviews.text: Used the the stuff sack to crush down the sleeping bag. Worked like a charm! A bit fussy to use, but after a few uses, one gets used to the procedure.
customer_reviews.author: S. McClain

customer_reviews.title: Great bag for a Moto adventure
customer_reviews.text: This was a perfect waterproof sack for a motorcycle adventure. Space is at a premium in saddlebags and I used this bag for my rain gear. Super compressible and the perfect size for my Moto needs.
customer_reviews.author: Liz

customer_reviews.title: Nice compact stuff sack
customer_reviews.text: This was a great stuff sack Used for a sleeping bag which did not come with a cover and worked well.
customer_reviews.author: Scristi

customer_reviews.title: Great replacement stuff sack
customer_reviews.text: The small is the perfect size for my down-filled 30 degree sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Keith  Niedermeier

customer_reviews.title: Great!!
customer_reviews.text: I love this bag, I 2 of these for trips on my motorcycle, 1 for clean clothes and 1 for dirty, they compress down and fit in my saddle bags perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: AmazonUser

customer_reviews.title: 3 Compression Straps.....not 4.
customer_reviews.text: Great compression sack for the price. 4/5 stars because of 3 compression straps as apposed to SeatoSummit and others that have 4.
customer_reviews.author: Laura DeBruine

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality, works well for intended purpose
customer_reviews.text: Reasonably priced. Bought the 3-10L for my Marmot 32 degree down, as I wanted to compress it further than what the original stuff sack allowed for. Works great. Might get the smaller one for clothes.
customer_reviews.author: Standard Knight Co.

customer_reviews.title: Works very well
customer_reviews.text: Very light compression was excellent. Totally satisfied with this product
customer_reviews.author: Poohbhar

customer_reviews.title: Light weight but can't compress as expected
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight but it cannot compress into smaller size. I ordered a small. It can only compress into 1/3 of its height. Kind of disappointed. I am still debating if I should return it.
customer_reviews.author: Ms Piggy

customer_reviews.title: Works even better than I expected!
customer_reviews.text: This compression sack is amazing!! It seriously saved me 4 inches in my backpack for my upcoming trip to Peru, and every inch is valuable! The material is super sturdy and feels high quality. And a bonus is it took me less than 45 seconds to do it all!
customer_reviews.author: Ellie Beck

customer_reviews.title: Worked just perfect for me
customer_reviews.text: Got this for my Bozeman +20 degree sleeping bag and this compressed it perfectly to fit in my backpack. Held up great on the daily use of the Colorado Trail. Seams, and straps held just fine.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: These are very light weight and durable. I used ...
customer_reviews.text: These are very light weight and durable. I used them on a two month long bike trip. they compressed my gear so it all fit in my panniers.
customer_reviews.author: happy traveler

customer_reviews.title: Decent quality for the price
customer_reviews.text: At this price point, I wouldn't expect it to be much better than it is. I would buy this again if I had a need for it. Quite light weight.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Butler

customer_reviews.title: Good sack
customer_reviews.text: Wanted to stuff a pillow in while camping. Worked like a champ.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Smith

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: Just as light or lighter when compared to some others (OR, Kelty). Not as heavy a grade of nylon, which might or might not matter, depends on your application. It is less $. It has three straps instead of four.
customer_reviews.author: Grinchy

customer_reviews.title: I kept it because I can put it to good use somewhere
customer_reviews.text: Disappointing. Rather flimsy material and not as large as I thought it would be. I kept it because I can put it to good use somewhere, but for now, meh.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worked great with my sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.text: Very light weight and appears to be fairly strong material. Only time and use will tell. I poured water over it and it did bead up and roll off like they show in the photo so it is water resistant. Didn't test it anymore than that.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth R. Walker

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size
customer_reviews.text: Received the small sack and it fit a 3.5 pound down blanket as if it was made for it. It was pretty close to size. Length was a little shorter then advertised but circumference was perfect. Product seems to be of nice quality and I expect it to work for my needs.
customer_reviews.author: manduhlin

customer_reviews.title: Nice bag
customer_reviews.text: Good siza bag. Will hold a full size sleeping bag with ease. Straps seem a little weak for the job but haven't broken yet. All in all a good product for a good price.
customer_reviews.author: Wayne Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: Better than a lot of the more well known brands ...
customer_reviews.text: Better than a lot of the more well known brands in terms of quality, price and materials. This is a really well made compression sac for hiking and mountaineering and I have 5 of them. I wouldn't use it for water based sports though.
customer_reviews.author: Mrinalini Watsa

customer_reviews.title: Two of the three buckles loosen on their own, really annoying.
customer_reviews.text: two of the three buckles loosen on their own, really annoying.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob R. Estes

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly. Solid quality.
customer_reviews.text: Fit my teton spots 20 degree scout sized sleeping bag no problem! (20L bag)
customer_reviews.author: Mike110715

customer_reviews.title: I like it
customer_reviews.text: I've used this for a couple years now. I haven't torn any seams yet.
customer_reviews.author: ch3645

customer_reviews.title: Wonderful compression sack
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these. One for my two person tent + rainfly (S) and one for my top quilt (XS). I just ordered a medium just to have because I like these so much!
customer_reviews.author: Charise

customer_reviews.title: ... was gonna use it for but I found a good use for it
customer_reviews.text: This was smaller that what I thought it was and what I was gonna use it for but I found a good use for it.t was able to pick a down blanket and a sall pillow in it. The straps held tight and the fabric was strong enough to take the tightening of the straps. Saved me a lot of space while camping. Great item.
customer_reviews.author: L. Duch

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I must admit i was surprised at how well these work.
customer_reviews.author: Chris E

customer_reviews.title: There are much much better ones on the market
customer_reviews.text: This is just an ok compression and stuff sack. There are much much better ones on the market, however this product is probably appropriate for its price
customer_reviews.author: Elise

customer_reviews.title: Not worth the cheap price
customer_reviews.text: The straps are SO thin that compression takes forever. Just a pain.
customer_reviews.author: Tina

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size and fit for my sleeping bag!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best compression sack I have bought that didn't cost a arm and a leg. Perfect for my sleeping bag to be compressed. I got the 14 I think and could be more perfect for a down sleeping bag.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany Ponder

customer_reviews.title: Great sack for camping.
customer_reviews.text: The compression sack did not fit my sleeping bag, but I was able to use it for other purposes. It works great for bundles of clothes and doubles as a pillow.
customer_reviews.author: CLTMahaffey

customer_reviews.title: Good Value.
customer_reviews.text: Using this for my DIY hammock underquilt. Works perfectly. Don't expect the same quality as a $50-$60 dry bag/compression sack, but it's a good value for the price. I would buy another.
customer_reviews.author: Dylan

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Great sack for the price! Tough and light! Compresses well! Took it backpacking in Hawaii with no complaints. The med size fits the 20 deg kelty cosmic bag perfectly
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Thomas

customer_reviews.title: One Star
customer_reviews.text: Very thin, flimsy material. It might be suitable for compressing soft fabrics, but not anything more substantial.
customer_reviews.author: ESL teacher

customer_reviews.title: Pretty good compressor bag, but not as waterproof as I would have liked.
customer_reviews.text: Construction of the bag is good and it works well as a compression bag. However I would not classify the body fabric (green in picture) to be truly "waterproof" I tested the fabric by trying to suck air through it using my mouth and I found that the fabric is not "airtight" -- which is my standard for "waterproof" . Backpacking in the Pacific Northwest where day long rain, hiking on snow and wading creeks are part of the game I want a stuff sack that will keep my bag dry -- even if I fall in the creek. I would need to use a garbage bag liner on these bags to ensure dryness in that extreme case.
customer_reviews.author: R. Oakley

customer_reviews.title: Good Value; Fit Single Sleeping Bag
customer_reviews.text: This was a replacement for one we borrowed and lost, so I can't speak for its durability, but a normal sleeping bag fit fine, at a cost well below what the local sporting/camping store wanted.
customer_reviews.author: Cassandra

customer_reviews.title: Great stuff bag for the money.
customer_reviews.text: Great stuff sack for the money. Very durable. Made well.
customer_reviews.author: J Harry Blalock

customer_reviews.title: Great little compression bag
customer_reviews.text: Great little compression bag, can fit an entire change of lightweight clothing {shirt, pants, socks, and underwear ] in it when packed tightly.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Three Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad sack for the price but not waterproof.
customer_reviews.author: MORETTI OUTDOORS

customer_reviews.title: very nice stuff sack
customer_reviews.text: Seems durable, no issues so far. put it to the test and look forward to it being in my regular gear
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: lightweight and effective
customer_reviews.text: Lightweight and effective. Should have bought a larger size for my mummy bag.
customer_reviews.author: Stark Twain

customer_reviews.title: Great deal!
customer_reviews.text: For the cost it is a great deal, I use it to put my camp clothes in and it reduces the volume by close to 50%.
customer_reviews.author: Russ

customer_reviews.title: This is not a 6 liter bag it is maybe a two and a half liter bag.
customer_reviews.text: The description said approximately 6 LOL, I had a hard time putting a 2 liter bottle in this bag but it does look very nice and I'm going to keep it for my clothes but I was hoping to put my tent in it.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Comes in handy when you want to travel/camp light and save space
customer_reviews.text: Does what it is supposed to! Compresses and holds it in even if you toss it around.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: bad strap and buckle location design
customer_reviews.text: The straps and buckles are designed in such a way as not compressing items as much as they can be. Poor thought went into the product design.
customer_reviews.author: Adam Steinman

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, well constructed. I like the 3 strap design. Only suggestion for improvement is it would be nice if there was more range to compress it.
customer_reviews.author: ILoveAmazonPrime

customer_reviews.title: Super thin, light, and strong
customer_reviews.text: This thing is super thin, light, and strong. So far so good.
customer_reviews.author: DaveCon

customer_reviews.title: good value
customer_reviews.text: It ain't Sea to Summit Ulta-sil but not a bad sack for the price if waterproof is not required.
customer_reviews.author: Mark W.

customer_reviews.title: PERFECTLY PERFECT
customer_reviews.text: PERFECTLY GREAT. BRIGHT COLOR - EASY FOR MY KID TO STUFF AND STANDS OUT FROM HIS FRIENDS. PACKS DOWN SUPER SMALL!!
customer_reviews.author: J. S.

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: I really like these light weight compression sacks. I own several and recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: btrhoads

customer_reviews.title: Nice stuff sack.  Uncertain of durability
customer_reviews.text: Nice compression mechanism. Material seems a bit light for the duty.
customer_reviews.author: Marty Z
